examples:
$ btf flaky --dir=/some/test/dir --runs=10
# outputs any tests which failed from 10 runs

dir.name: dir
dir.description: the directory containing tests to search

runs.name: runs
runs.description: number of test runs to execute

interactive.description: Find tests that interact with each other
examples:
$ btf interactive --dir=/some/test/dir
# outputs tests from the given directory which failed either when run individually or all together

dir.name: dir
dir.description: the directory containing tests to search

large.description: Find tests that have too many lines of code
examples:
$ btf large --dir=/some/test/dir --lines=50 --top=20
# outputs the 20 largest tests from the given directory that have at least 50 lines

dir.name: dir
dir.description: the directory containing tests to search

lines.name: lines
lines.description: number of lines of test code that is too many

slow.description: Find tests that take a long time to execute
examples:
$ btf slow --dir=/some/test/dir --milliSeconds=500 --top=20
# outputs the 20 slowest tests from the given directory that take at least 500 milliseconds

dir.name: dir
dir.description: the directory containing tests to search

milliSeconds.name: milliSeconds
milliSeconds.description: number of milliseconds to execute that is too many
